intro: Echites brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed echites, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Echites brevipes is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it adapts well to dry and nutrient-poor conditions.
